description: The channel — home to Disney shows and Canadian favourites like Life With Derek and The Next Step — is no longer, after parent company WildBrain deemed four of its channels "no longer commercially viable."
title: Canadian kids network Family Channel to shutter in coming months

description: About 780,000 pressure washers sold at retailers like Home Depot are being recalled across the U.S. and Canada, due to a projectile hazard that has resulted in fractures and other injuries among some consumers.
title: Ryobi-branded electric pressure washers recalled after injuries, fractures reported

description: Canada's parliamentary budget officer estimates that the federal government spent $71.1 billion on wages and other personnel costs last year, despite the public service shedding about 10,000 jobs.
title: Federal spending on personnel hit $71B in 2024-25: Budget watchdog

description: A new incarnation of Zellers is set to open in Edmonton's Londonderry Mall, after the defunct Hudson's Bay Company transferred the discount retailer's brand trademarks to the owner of Fairweather and International Clothiers, according to federal registries.
title: Zellers returns — again — this time starting in Edmonton

description: The top U.S. public health agency was left reeling and leaderless as the White House works to expel its handpicked director from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Pre
title: Chaos swirls at U.S. CDC amid messy Trump admin effort to oust director

description: Anti-smoking advocates urged the provinces and territories to use money from a historic tobacco settlement on public health programs as the provinces are set to receive initial amounts starting Friday.
title: Billions to flow to provinces as part of historic tobacco settlement

description: Lawmakers from several levels of government were joined by gun control advocates in Minneapolis Thursday to call for state and federal gun control in the wake of a shooting at a Catholic church Wednesday in which two children were killed and 18 other people, mostly kids, were wounded.
title: 'No more thoughts and prayers': Minnesota lawmakers and advocates plead for gun control

description: A Swift Current, Sask., man has been in a coma for several weeks after being bitten by a rattlesnake in Texas. After spending time at a hospital in the U.S., he has been transferred to Regina, where his family awaits the results of tests determining brain damage.
title: Sask. man remains in coma after rattlesnake bite in Texas

description: The Canadian sports system is rife with abuse and fosters a culture that discourages athletes from speaking out, according to a scathing review from a commission the federal government launched to probe systemic abuse in sports.
title: Canada's sports system is 'broken' and suffers from widespread abuse: Federal commission

description: Canada's five biggest banks reported their third quarter earnings this week, setting aside less money for loan-related losses as the Canada-U.S. trade tensions that pushed lenders to build their reserves eased.
title: Canada's biggest banks beat 3rd quarter expectations as trade pressures ease

description: It was the crash that launched a thousand quips — and yes, it really happened. A driver collided with a driver examination centre in southwestern Ontario.
title: Yes, a driver crashed into an Ontario drive test centre. Here's what happened

description: A key figure in the 2022 "Freedom Convoy" who's seeking asylum in the United States is being sought on a Canada-wide warrant after he failed to appear in court in Ottawa to face criminal charges for his role in the protest.
title: Convoy figure seeking U.S. asylum wanted on Canada-wide warrant

description: A showdown between Hudson's Bay and a group of landlords opposing the retailer's push to sell about two dozen of its leases to a B.C. billionaire got underway in court today. The battle has been simmering ever since the Bay announced in May that it had selected Ruby Liu to buy 28 of its leases.
title: Hudson's Bay battle over sale of leases to B.C. billionaire underway at Toronto court

description: Craig Michael Thompson has been convicted of securities fraud and ordered to pay $8.8 million in penalties and costs by the Alberta Securities Commission.
title: Calgarian who ran $150-million 'classic Ponzi scheme' ordered to pay $8.8 million in penalties

description: The Nova Scotia government has confirmed 20 homes were destroyed last weekend in the Annapolis County wildfire.
title: 20 homes destroyed in Annapolis County, N.S., wildfire

description: Finance Minister Nate Horner says softening oil prices mean this year's projected budget deficit is expected to grow by $1.3 billion, and will now finish at $6.5 billion in the red when the fiscal year ends next spring.
title: Alberta now on track for even bigger budget deficit, now at $6.5B

description: An international green banking alliance that Prime Minister Mark Carney helped establish is now suspending its activities and holding a vote to determine its future.
title: Green banking alliance Carney helped create pauses activities, holds vote on its future
Quebec plans to table bill to ban praying in public

description: A large sinkhole has closed an east end intersection in Toronto and flooded at least two basements following a water main break late Wednesday night, the city says.
title: Sinkhole closes east end intersection in Toronto

description: U.S. Open opponents Taylor Townsend and Jelena Ostapenko got into a face-to-face argument on the Court 11 sideline right after Townsend won their second-round match 7-5, 6-1 on Wednesday.
title: Boisterous U.S. Open once again serves drama with fiery Townsend, Ostapenko spat

description: The federal government has appointed a new envoy to India, more than 10 months after security officials accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government of espionage and violence, setting off a tense diplomatic dispute.
title: Canada names new envoy to India as tensions between 2 countries thaw

description: U.S. Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook has sued the Trump administration in an effort to overturn the president's attempt to fire her, launching an unprecedented legal battle that could significantly reshape the Fed's longstanding political independence.
title: U.S. Fed governor Lisa Cook is suing Trump administration to block attempt to fire her

description: Ford Motor is recalling 52,547 vehicles in Canada and nearly 500,000 vehicles in the U.S over a brake fluid leak issue, the company confirmed on Thursday.
title: Ford recalls more than 52,500 vehicles in Canada over brake fluid leak
Big hits, great saves: B.C. players shine at inaugural Women's Para Hockey World Championships

description: From the Smithsonian to the classroom, President Trump is targeting cultural and educational institutions to promote a ‘patriotic’ version of history. We speak to a leading civil rights figure and historian about why that matters for the present.
title: Trump, the Smithsonian, and the battle over U.S. history

description: Police officers are speaking out about a backyard hot tub and pool party that ultimately led to the suspension of five officers — including three from the tactical unit — and allegations of assault and professional misconduct involving a member of an outlaw motorcycle gang.
title: Saskatoon officers break silence on house party that led to 5 suspensions

description: A pair of businesses near the St. Margaret's Bay trail say they are struggling to draw in customers and make ends meet.
title: Businesses that rely on hikers, cyclists take a hit due to N.S. trail closures

description: Jay Hector's introduction to solar panels began with a knock on the door of his Calgary home — and ended with an oversized bill when he learned he'd paid more than triple the going rate. He's warning people to do their research, even as industry insiders say "high-pressure" sales tactics are a challenge facing the sector.
title: He paid triple the going rate for solar panels. Now he warns people to research door-to-door contracts

description: An independent committee’s 50 recommendations to Quebec are drawing criticism from some community leaders such as Farida Mohamed, who said the rights and economic freedom of Muslim women would be violated.
title: Muslim leaders say Quebec report on secularism is discriminatory

description: Christos Kyriacou, owner of Angel’s Diner in Guelph, Ont., spent the last three months trying to get $34,000 back after accidentally overpaying his internet bill, a mistake he says caused him a lot of stress. A Bell spokesperson says such an experience isn't normal.
title: Ontario businessman paid $34K for internet after making a typo. It took 3 months to fix it

description: A South Woodslee, Ont., nursing home resident faces eviction after an altercation with a fellow resident led to an assault charge against the 71-year-old. But the man's family is advocating for him to stay put until they can secure safe alternative living arrangements.
title: Ontario nursing home resident faces eviction due to an assault charge. The family refuses to move him

description: In June, a 40-year-old mother died days after giving birth. Her family believes medical staff at Mississauga's Credit Valley Hospital didn't act quickly enough when she first presented signs of sepsis.
title: She died of septic shock after childbirth. Her family says faster treatment could've saved her

description: Thousands of people stood in line for hours — some even waiting overnight — for a clothing sale in Vancouver this week, in what one consumer expert says is a reflection of clever marketing and the cost-of-living crisis.
title: Shoppers endure massive crowds for Aritzia warehouse sale in Vancouver

description: Two months after the welcome sign of a popular Ontario beach town came down in the night, Canada's top cour
title: Supreme Court dismisses appeal attempt in treaty dispute over Ontario beach

description: A group of orcas thrilled a party of friends on the waters of Howe Sound in B.C.
title: Orcas put on 'quite the show' for B.C. boaters in Howe Sound
